summary: This document appears to be a financial record related to Deutsche Bank's Wealth Management services, detailing customer identification policies and account management procedures. It emphasizes the bank's obligations under federal law to verify customer identities and maintain compliance with anti-money laundering regulations.
keyFacts: The document outlines Deutsche Bank's customer identification policy, which requires verification of identity for account establishment.
It mentions the legal obligations of financial institutions to assist in the fight against money laundering and terrorist financing.
The document includes references to various types of accounts offered by Deutsche Bank, such as checking accounts and certificates of deposit.
There are requirements for clients to notify the bank of any changes to their personal or institutional information.
The document is marked confidential and is part of a series of records related to financial compliance.
